p: Without attracting the same level of attention as ZIKV, other emerging flaviviruses are affecting an increasing number of people. In particular, viruses infecting birds, such as West Nile virus (WNV) and Usutu virus (USUV), have been related to recent cases of neurologic disease in temperate countries ( 11 – 14). Increased incidence of flaviviral disease seems to be connected to climate change and its impact on the migratory dynamics of birds and the geographic spread of mosquito vectors ( 15 – 18). USUV has caused recent epidemics in birds across Europe, with elevated mortality in some species, such as blackbirds, owls, and other wild and captive animals ( 15, 19). Recent sporadic cases of human disease geographically connected to these outbreaks are raising concerns of USUV becoming a potential threat to global health ( 11, 13, 15, 18, 20 – 24).
